newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Brent steady, but pressure to hit new low.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Brent steady, but pressure to hit new low.

text.p: Brent crude futures were untraded by midday on Tuesday but were under pressure to break below key support at $17.54, brokers said.
July Brent was quoted on SIMEX at $17.45/$17.60 per barrel after London settled at $17.56 per barrel for a loss of 14 cents on the day.
However, July traded in London time as low as $17.54 -- the lowest since April 10. A break below $17.54 would take prices to their lowest level since June 14, 1996.
Brokers said Brent was likely to fall below $17.54 later in the day or during London trading.
NYMEX July futures were down on ACCESS after New York dropped 11 cents to $18.68 after hitting a fresh 16 month low of $18.60.
July NYMEX was last traded on ACCESS at $18.62 per barrel after falling in New York ACCESS trade to $18.55.
Rising crude stocks and refinery runs in the U.S., ample Atlantic Basin supply and a renewal of the Iraq oil-for-food deal were undermining prices.
